text: Vidya Thakur (born 15 June 1963) is a leader of Bharatiya Janata Party and a member of 13th Maharashtra Legislative Assembly from Goregaon.http://indianexpress.com/article/cities/mumbai/giant-killers-2/ She is Minister of State for Women and Child Development, Food and Civil Supplies and Consumer Protection, Food and Drugs Administrationhttp://www.sarkaritel.com/states/council_of_ministers.php?state=MH in Devendra Fadnavis Ministry. On 10 July 2016 she was relieved of responsibility for food and drug administration in a cabinet reshuffle. ==Education and early career== Thakur attended Kudilal Govindram Sekseria Sarvodaya School, finishing in 1977.http://myneta.info/maharashtra2014/candidate.php?candidate_id=955 ==Political career== Vidya Thakur first time won election of Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation in 1992. ===Positions held=== ====Within BJP==== *Ex. General Secretary BJP Mumbai Mahila Morcha ====Legislative==== *Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation 2007 *Ex.Public Health Committee Chairperson *Deputy Mayor, Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation on 17 March 2007http://www.oneindia.com/2007/03/10/dr-shubha-raul-mayor-vidya-thakur-dy- mayor-of-mumbai-1174121999.htmlhttp://niyazvanu.tripod.com/id17.html *Member, Maharashtra Legislative Assembly - since 2014 ==See also== * Devendra Fadnavis ministry (2014–) * Make in Maharashtra ==References== Category:Members of the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly Category:Living people Category:1963 births Category:Maharashtra MLAs 2014–2019 Category:Women in Maharashtra politics Category:People from Mumbai Suburban district Category:Marathi politicians Category:21st-century Indian women politicians Category:21st-century Indian politicians
title: Vidya Thakur
